0.Pros: free food when I wanted it

1.Pros: location close to home, somewhat nice coworkers
1.Cons: low pay, can get busy sometimes

2.Pros: I worked there for 3 years its a good place to be if u are willing to learn .
2.Cons: They have great benefits and have the best opportunities if u are a people person.

3.Summary: "McDonald's definitely gives you a whammy of experience."
3.Pros: Teaches you to deal with and manage a lot of unpleasant work. Although people may not necessarily be proud to be a McDonald's employee, you get out what you put into it.
3.Cons: I gained weight working here because there was fast food all around us all the time. The hunger was contagious and binge eating was not an uncommon thing.

4.Summary: "Lots Of hours at The store running The floor"
4.Pros: Flexibility in regards to your own scheduleBonos up to 12,000 base on performance5 sick days if you don't use them they pay you. Vacations 2 weeks and up
4.Cons: Overworked, 12 hrs shifts, 6 days a week lots of times. Lock of crew & managers. Lots of no call no show. Weekends are super busy. From 7 am to 9pm. The goals for your labor are difficult to achieve.

5.Pros: Great place to work and develop. Fun fast paced environment. Ability to progress and learn as an individual.
5.Cons: Sometimes things happen that you just can't control. Maybe a bus pulls up or your fryers go down, it can be tough.

6.Pros: There are flexible hours and easy to get time off (due to the large number of employees)
6.Cons: Demanding work that doesn't match compensation. No career path unless you're there 10+ years

7.Pros: People you work with are nice. You get customers who are so nice and polite it's makes the job worth having.
7.Cons: Long hours on feet. You can get bad customers to deal with. It is pretty hot in the kitchen

8.Pros: Overall easy job, not much difficulty if any at all.
8.Cons: Overbearing management can be an issue.
